Legislation to control violent animal rights extremists will be toughened, the government announced yesterday. The National Association of Pension Funds may offer a reward for information leading to ringleaders being jailed.

Lord Sainsbury, the science minister, dismissed calls from the biotechnology industry for a single piece of new legislation to tackle animal extremism. However, he stated that additional provisions to existing public order laws would be introduced shortly.

"There will be new legislationâ€”though its extent remains undecided," he told the Lords. "The government does not believe in a single piece of legislation due to its potential slowness in implementation. They plan to address specific issues through attached bills." Animal research must continue, he emphasized.
